title: Water on earth
explainText:
A natural ice body that has been on the surface of polar or
alpine regions for many years and moves along the surface

A stream that flows frequently or intermittently along 
a narrow depression in a given area
A large body of water surrounded by land

The earth's surface is divided by land into vast stretches of water connected to each other,
occupying three quarters of the earth's surface. The central part is called the ocean 
and the marginal part is called the sea.
